artist: George Grant Elmslie American Terra Cotta and Ceramic Company
creditline: Gift of The Security State Bank, Hector Minnesota, through the auspices of Mr. David Spreiter
description: Decorative Frieze from old Farmers and Merchants Bank, Hector Minnesota; terra cotta
text: The pods, berries, and “lettuce leaves” in this tile connect Elmslie’s designs with his prior employer and mentor Louis Sullivan. You can see examples of Sullivan’s ornamental plaster ceramic reliefs in this gallery. These terra cotta blocks divided the brick lower level from the stucco second story of the Farmers and Merchants Bank, and were removed in 1970 when the bank was renovated.
title: Section of a frieze
